column4: so i installed dropbox from the .deb package from their site, how do i uninstall it so i can reinstall it?
is there like a -u flag for .deb files?
dpkg -l \*dropbox\* | grep ^ii
that will show you al packages installed with dropbox in the name
nautilus-dropbox comes up
then hat package is installed
so if its installed, why cant i apt-get purge it?
what is the output of "apt-get remove --purge nautilus-dropbox"
why should that not work?
LjL: that did some good. nautilus-dropbox purged successfully. however, my problem was always with the daemon not running. ill see if that works now on reinstall.
LjL Pici: before i attempt to reinstall from .deb pkg, should i first do "dpkg -r dropboxpkg.deb"?
not dpkg -r foo.deb  just dpkg -r foo
when "dpkg -l \*dropbox*\ | grep ^ii is not showing anything dropbox is not installed

LjL Pici : when i open downloaded 32bit .deb file for dropbox, Software Center is saying "Sorry, 'nautilus-dropbox' is not available for this type of computer (i386)" but i KNOW this is a 32bit machine
output of "dpkg --print-architecture"
ok then its 32bit
output of "sudo apt-get install nautilus-dropbox"
E: Unable to locate package nautilus-dropbox
output of "cat /etc/issue" and "cat /etc/apt/sources.list"
what are you doing exactly?
